p: Justification for conservation actions: This hybrid is known to occur in existing protected areas within its natural range with almost 35% of the known individuals under protection. In the BVI, this hybrid is recorded in Sage Mountain National Park and Shark Bay National Park on the island of Tortola. In the USVI, it occurs within the Virgin Islands National Park on the island of St John. In the BVI, this species occurs within the designated Tortola North Shore BVI TIPA ( Sanchez et al. 2019). Conservation actions should mainly focus on control of invasive mammals, monitoring the suitable habitat of this hybrid and its parent species and further research is required into this hybrid species traits and ecology to understand its role in the wider ecosystem.
